alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued October 11 at 5:12PM MDT until October 13 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Northwest winds at 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Entire Tri-State area. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Reductions in visibility associated with blowing dust are possible, mainly in northeast Colorado and far northwest Kansas late Thursday afternoon and early Thursday evening, as winds suddenly shift to the northwest and strengthen.
info.instruction: A High Wind Watch means that sustained winds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or greater are possible. Wind of this magnitude may down trees, power lines, and damage property. Secure loose outdoor items and stay tuned for later forecasts and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
